lexUnit.name: frown.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: furrow one's brows in an expression indicating disapproval, displeasure, or concentration.

sentence.text: She frowned at Beth when an awful thought suddenly occurred to her .
He came and stood behind her , staring over her shoulder at the screen , frowning darkly at the columns of figures displayed .
The old lady frowned at him and asked him sharply what his name was and he sat up straight but he answered cheekily .
She frowned in concentration but at the same time she suddenly looked very tired , as though she should stop and sit down .
Anneliese was frowning in concern , studying her face then casting a quick , accusing glance at her elder brother .
Ronni flushed and frowned in shameful consternation .
She jumped up , frowning in dismay .
As he turned and handed the binoculars to his elder brother he frowned in what he hoped was a manly , intent manner and tried to make his voice sound casual .
Miss Labrooy frowned in puzzlement .
Loretta frowned to herself , aware that Geoffrey was taking great pleasure in showing off his superior knowledge .
Shiona frowned to herself .
He stopped and frowned to himself .
He was coming so fast that she knew he had not seen her and she had to brake sharply , frowning with exasperation .
She could n't see without her glasses , which made her frown with frustration .
She frowned with irritation but spoke with her usual friendliness as , walking round the side of the house , she found Constance propping up her bike against the porch .
Frau Nordern frowned as Marx stubbed out his cigar and promptly took out another one .
She frowned as questions began to whirl in her mind .
Mr Justice Buchanan frowned before asking if there were any chance of a unanimous verdict being reached if he allowed more time .
Tom Witherington frowned .
Aycliffe frowned a little .
She frowned a little .
She sipped her tea thoughtfully , staring in front of her and frowning a little .
Dyson took off his overcoat and went to his desk , frowning heavily .
George frowned sharply , irritated at being stopped just as he was getting well into his stride .
He peered through the lens , frowning slightly .
She frowned thoughtfully as she refilled her cup .
He sat frowning , staring back at Evans , then decided .
Lonie shut her eyes and frowned .
Madeleine stiffened and frowned .
He scanned the empty horizon and frowned , and she quivered , suddenly afraid at the savage look in his eyes .
Munro frowned , thinking about it .
